item.title: Demonstratives
item.description: Words used to indicate which entities are being referred to and to distinguish those entities from others https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demonstrative Groups of words with a similar ko-so-a-do pattern. こ: close to the speaker (e.g. “this dog”) そ: close to the listener (e.g. “that store”). あ: far from both speaker and listener, but that can be seen or understood (e.g. “that mountain over there”). ど: questioning what or which (e.g. “what car?

item.title: Similar Words
item.description: 明らか and 明白 明らか = neutral, for conversation and writing 明白 = more polite, usually used for writing https://hinative.com/ja/questions/354061

item.title: Particles
item.description: は (wa) 1. Topic marker Marks the topic of discussion. Can be thought of like “as for” or “regarding”. 明日あしたは火か曜日ようびですAs for tomorrow, it's Tuesday = Tomorrow is Tuesday 2. Contrast marker Shows contrast between several things in a sentence. 肉にくは食たべますが、魚さかなは食たべませんI eat meat, but I don't eat fish The contrasting thing can also be implied rather than explicitly stated. あの映えい画がは見みませんでしたI didn't see that movie (Can imply I saw this one)
